@Fozz13 I don't think I am. NTR isn't just basic genre like rape, bestially, scat, gore, etc. It's psychological genre like horror and psychological. Thus, it can't be based on how many times the partner engages in sexual activity with other people or how loyal the partner is after he/she engages in sexual activity. It doesn't always mean they're cheating too. I could be they're having feeling for each other, or  in close relationship (family, childhood friend, etc). The point is for you, the reader, to feel like someone who's precious to you being stolen by another people. Those feeling could be manifest as anger, sad, injustice, disgusted, etc. And from what you said, you already feel at least one of them while those feeling isn't normally able to be found in simply cheating genre. So yeah, I think it's still NTR but it also has cheating genre.

This is NTR, NTR is focused on psychological aspect by influencing the reader to sympathize with the person that being cheated on, eg. Displaying close relationship in detail between victim and cheater, showing victim's reaction (ignorant, aroused, crying, etc), conflict between guilt and pleasure of person who cheats, etc.

While cheating is focused on building experience as the 'cheater'. Displaying victim of cheating's emotion/ reaction isn't necessary or kept into minimal.

To me these does seem somewhat realistic, its also already hinted at the earlier panels that she wants it despite her "hating" him. Having understand this, makes the atmosphete all the more erotic and steamy. 

I would give 9/10, the art still isn't stale for me but the plot is barely original and it does seem lacking more panels (where they get it on more often and even possibly enter a threesome relationship).

Yes, it is downright controversial. But just like how video games are believed to influence violence by some, it is not entirely true as does netorare influence cuckolds. If anything, this is art of portraying hidden inner sexual frustration that is unfurtunately unleashed elswhere other than their partner, that is what I at least focus myself in on the netorare genre.

lastly, this genre is obviously not for everyone or for the faint of heart who could not easily grasp the intention of the art work.

@dobuch its has nothing to do with finding out or not. NTR is when someone is forced (blackmail, rape, etc) into a sexual relationship besides his/her partner. Cheating is what the name says, getting in a relationship besides the partner from her/his own will. Even though here she was against it, she never fought back or showed hating doing it. Probably the reason why the uploader didn't put the NTR tag.
